sentences: Ma nägin eile teatris head filmi.
Meie lapsed ei näe hästi ilma prillideta.
context: The Estonian verb 'nägema' means 'to see' or 'to look' in English. It's a common verb used to describe the act of perceiving something visually. The word can be conjugated in different tenses: nägin (past), näed (present 2nd person), näevad (present plural). In Estonian, it requires the partitive case when indicating what is being seen, unlike English which typically uses the direct object.
